lexUnit.name: whisper.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak very softly using one's breath rather than one's throat.

sentence.text: ` Is it a seduction job again ? " she whispered .
` Let me go , let me go , " she whispered , discovering her helplessness too late .
" I 'm with child , " she whispered , and faced them , tears going down her cheeks .
` I waited for you , my son , " the weak voice whispered .
` Roger , " Benjamin whispered , ` come with me . "
` I thought you 'd feel trapped , " she whispered .
` Not if you shut up , " whispered Philip .
` Take her to the cart , " whispered Jean .
" Do n't answer it , " whispered Selina .
` You examine it , Brother , " whispered Cranston .
` You do n't think we can do it , " whispered the bald man .
` Well at least that proves ` e knows where ` e's goin' , " whispered Tommy .
Seeing a youth of about 17 about to cycle away , Harry whispered that he was RAF and did he know anyone who could help .
The other bands whispered that Joseph would now head for Lapwai , abandoning them as Lawyer had done .
Over the next few days , more posters went up and as I read them , students whispered that ` something might happen " .
" Mrs Plant , " Timothy said quite softly , and Mr Plant whispered that if he issued another sound he would thump him to a pulp .
One girl whispered that she could n't tell anyone at home , because they used drugs .
He tried his nicest smile , and prepared to whisper his suavest come-on line .
He waited for an answer , then he whispered the words of forgiveness .
I crouch on the floor while Des whispers a commentary .
He whispered the names of the Jaguthin , and his fists clenched with pain .
She barely whispered the words .
` If you so much as whisper a word about Dame Agatha to the Lady Maeve , you will regret the day I ever plucked you out of Newgate ! "
The proprietor took over , and was still serving the portions when one of the waitresses came in and whispered something to Delaney .
They hurriedly whispered their good-byes to each other and after the front door had been closed Willie followed Zach back into his bedroom .
Ann whispered the question to Harry while the new arrival was being led upstairs by her cousins to see the house .
She whispered something to Mum , who furtively disappeared from the scene .
Endill had to move quickly past the cage but managed to whisper a faint goodbye to the Bookman .
Dieter bent to whisper something in her ear , at which she gave a squeal of laughter .
Yeb whispers a hoarse sorry in my ear .
Well before Cordoba made his debut over today 's course two months ago , his name was being whispered behind many a well-respected hand as the one to be on for next year 's 2000 Guineas .
In the corridors of Congress the name ` Hauser " was whispered behind closed doors .
Inevitably the Communists were blamed , but it was whispered that the order was given by a prominent member of the government .
All sorts of names , including that of Graham Dilley , were being whispered .
Her words were whispered .
It was whispered that he would soon die and he did .
The words were whispered but Skipper George heard them .
The words were whispered in a soft western English accent , a gentle hint of Ireland making an enchanting spell for the eager listener .
I 've had enough of being talked about , everybody whispering about Auntie Mavis 's seances , everybody blaming me just for living with her . "
Sometimes she saw nurses whispering about her and wanted to hide .
One of his body squires heard him whispering about it to his Gascon favourite . "
Outside , she and Oliver whispered about Shildon .
As we pass a couple of girl guests clad in complete colour-coordinated beachwear outfits , they whisper about us .
Hillary whispered in his ear and took his speech out of her pocket .
The man behind me leant forward and whispered in my ear , ` Tell that guy to quit yapping will you ?
He smiled at the fancifulness of the thought , then caught his breath , seeing how her eyes flashed as she laughed at something her cousin had whispered in her ear .
While the hall echoes with laughter and stamping feet , Sara saw her mother whispering in her father 's ear , and a moment later she was beckoned to their presence .
` No , " she whispered in Isabel 's ear .
When she went out , Matthew , who was sitting quietly in his corner , whispered to Anne , ` Keep a little imagination , Anne , not too much , of course , just a little . "
` Are you sure you 're OK , Connie ? " he whispered to Connon as the others went ahead through the door .
Jean whispered to Fiona , who sniffed and glanced at the camera crew .
He whispered to her , but she did not move .
` Verlander , " she whispered to herself .
" If my father decides to beat me for what I did , " he whispered fiercely to himself , " please help me to endure the pain and not to cry .
` Asleep , " she whispered to me .
Elspeth whispered to her one night in their room that that 's where you go to buy babies .
He sheathed his dagger , whispered to Ranulf and Maltote to wait at the top of the alleyway , and knocked gently on the shop door .
Peter Young whispered into my ear , ` Never mind , Piper .
` You mean it does n't apply to me , " Evelyn whispered back .
Edward whispered back , stunned .
` Wild strawberries , " the Devil whispered back .
She whispered back : ` Or to your friend , Rosie ? "
` Do n't ask me , " he whispered back .
But they whisper about how could a woman fall downstairs , break her neck , and yet keep the hood on her head undisturbed ?
` I 'm not feeling well " , she whispered in somewhat imperfect French , and the woman moved hastily out of her way .
` In the meantime , " Rex whispered on .
` The coast 's clear , " Rob whispered conspiratorially as he came into Merrill 's room .
I whispered feverishly , glancing up to see Father 's shadow leave the wall on the floor above .
` 'T IS really nought , " she whispered nervously as he reached her and held out his hand .
Hoomey whispered , shocked .
Jane whispered , her mouth suddenly dry .
He leaned towards me and whispered .
Marion whispered and turned away because she could n't bear to be there when something died , when all the love that she had bottled up inside herself evaporated like liquid left out in the sun .
